page.title: 12Housing in Pantymwyn
page.content: Settlement at Pantymwyn really developed during the 18th and 19th centuries, when lead_mining was important here: the name Pantymwyn means 'The Valley of the Mine'. The settlement then was only scattered dwellings, now linked by further development - particularly along the roads of the area. In the earlier part of this century some small bungalows were built; in recent years there have been some further small developments of houses and bungalows, and some large new houses have been constructed on individual plots. The proximity of the attractive countryside here to the urban areas of Deeside and Merseyside has also led to the establishment of a number of static caravan-sites, for holiday use. Generally these sites are well screened by trees and do not obtrude on the landscape.
